intro: Grindelia spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leaf gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-green foliage and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal and inland deserts. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to withstand arid conditions. Grindelia spathulata is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
